dialogue.string: 4�There is an oddly shaped depression in the center of the grate.The grate does not seem to be a door, as it is one with the walls around it.
1�The 3???? begins to glow.
1�Insert the 3?????Yes.No.
1�But as one bright star shines through the clouds at night...
1�And as one song rings clear above the roar of beasts...
1�We hold to one hope in these darkest of times.
1�And someday, that hope will become our dreams...our prayers...
1�Use the transporting device?Yes.Not yet.
1�Use the transporting device?Yes.Not yet.
1�Long have I awaited thine arrival...
1�Welcome, mortals, to the Temple of Altana. Eons ago, this temple was destroyed. However, its appearance doth not hinder its function.
1�Thou hast come here to try and stop Eald'narche--to keep him from opening the Gate of the Gods...
1�I am Yve'noile, a servant of the Dawn Goddess. I watch over the path leading to the gate.
1�All the Zilart, including Eald'narche, are still bound by our cursed past.
1�As thou already know, his plan began ten thousand years ago when he came into contact with the five crystals that rest beneath the surface of Vana'diel. The true crystals...
1�The crystals that exist above the earth now are nothing but mere replicas, lacking true power.
1�We Zilart harnessed the five true crystals' power, divided it elementally, and succeeded in containing it in a smaller form.
1�However, during the Meltdown, the energy of these smaller crystals was simultaneously released and spread to the far reaches of Vana'diel.

1�Over centuries, that energy accumulated inside the bodies of the living beings on this planet, causing them to crystallize. Thus, they took the form of the crystals that are found throughout Vana'diel.
1�Mortals are an incomplete species. When Eald'narche's quest for Paradise was thwarted, life on this planet lost its perfection.
1�Particularly, thine inability to communicate with the others of thy race casts a shadow over thy development.
1�This inability became increasingly evident after the Meltdown divided thee into the five races.

1�The arrogance of the Elvaan, the envy of the Mithra, the cowardice of the Tarutaru, the apathy of the Humes, the rage of the Galka... These are the traits thou must carry with thee as thou make thy journeys through life.
1�However, unlike the tales thy legends tell, these traits are not some ancient curse. They are merely an aftereffect of the energy released during the Meltdown.
1�One can understand why Eald'narche would aspire for perfection...
1�However, one can see why others would acknowledge the benefits of imperfection.
1�On the other side of this gate lies the Gate of the Gods, Tu'Lia.
1�I beg of thee. Release Eald'narche, and what remains of the Zilart consciousness, from the crystal's binds.I pray for thy safe journey.
1�May the Goddess of the Dawn protect thee in Her mercy...
1�Alas, I can confess to hearing that name only once before in my lifetime.
1�The prophecies say that the Cloud of Darkness is fated to descend upon this land once the five pieces of the mothercrystal have turned to dust.
1�Were the pieces to be made whole once more, it is perhaps possible to avoid this most gloomy of futures.
1�But that day itself will signal the end of Vana'diel.
l!�You, and you alone, have the potential to guide them.
1�It seems as if we cannot continue on any further.
1�I am not certain about what he meant by being ??blessed by the light,?? but I do know that we need that 3???? you hold to find out.
1�What's going on? Does this mean our power was not accepted by the crystal?
1�We've been waiting for you,  .
1�I've got a score to settle with Eald'narche. It's time to put an end to that midget's plan!
1�So that's how it works...Well, there's no turning back now. Let's go, Zeid. You too,  .
1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, ?[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.

1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.The Gate of the Gods(pt.1).The Gate of the Gods(pt.2).Born of Her Nightmares.Death and Rebirth.Emissaries of God.Beneath a Blood-red Sky.Meanwhile, Back on Abyssea.Exploring the Ruins(pt.1).Exploring the Ruins(pt.2).Exploring the Ruins(pt.3).Exploring the Ruins(pt.4).Exploring the Ruins(pt.5).Exploring the Ruins(pt.6).Exploring the Ruins(pt.7).Become Something More(pt.1).Become Something More(pt.2).
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Now, listen close...
.?�Aldo...? Is that you...?
1�Aldo...My...brother...
1�Emeline!Can you hear me!?
1�Emeline...could it truly be?After all these years...
e!�(Curses!No...I won't let them take you from me again!)
1�Lost in a waking dream...just like me.
1�Deep in slumber, freed from the restraints of my physical body...It is here that the voice of the Seed Crystal speaks to me.
1�I awaken, only to remember nothing.
1�It's the same for mother, you see.Only in her dreams does she remember a past too frightening, too painful to face with waking eyes.
1�Only in her dreams does she remember you, Uncle Aldo.
1�Knowing this, would you open her eyes to the light of the world once more?
1�The choice belongs to you alone, Uncle.
1�And the power to save this world from destruction is yours,  .

1�You, and all living beings on Vana'diel.It is your will to live--your deep love for the world you call home--that is the key.Only you can instill the antiphon with the strength to counteract the echo...
1�So what will your choice be, Uncle Aldo?  ?
1�Will you silence the echo to save this world from destruction?Even knowing it would mean death for the sister you knew, will you do what must be done?
1�If you have the courage to answer, make way for the Stellar Fulcrum at the peak of Delkfutt's Tower.
1�We'll be waiting for you there.
1�Perhaps...we're all just living inside the crystal's dream.
1�It's no use, Uncle...where she is now, no words can reach her.Mother's dreaming, you see.
1�What will you say?That's not true!...
1�Do you have faith in Esha'ntarl?Aye, with all me heart!...Huh?
.)�Arrrg,  . Mighty good o' ye t' oblige me invite t' this out-o'-the-way place, matey.
1�Y'see, we be needin' the...errr, somethin' 'r whats hereabouts. Magenta field or some magnetic feel or some such. The sciency stuff be way off me maps. Here be monsters, yarrr.
1�Last we spoke--last I prrrattled, more like--I ga'e ye me solemn word I'd cork up me ramblin'.An' a pirate's word be as good as the gold he hoards. Arrrg.
1�So it oughta please ye t' know someone else'll do most o' the talkin' today.
1�Out ye come now, lil' missy.  's here an' awaitin' yer pleasurrre.
1�No call fer thanks, now. Hearin' out the whims o' peppy young lasses be as much a hobby o' mine as borin' hapless adventurers t' tears with me inane blatherin'. Arrrg.
1�Eh? A man-god? I gone me entirrre life thinkin' there be jus' the Goddess. Now ye say there also be a ??He???
1�Arrrg, this careerrr pirate ain't sure he follows...
1�Blimey...

1�I won't lie t' ye, missy. The bulk o' yer tale flew right over me head like a scrrreechin' gull.I think I grasp the meat o' it, though. This Proma...somethin'-or-other be the reason behind Abyssea's wretched state, aye?
1�But what be so terrible 'bout a dead deity bein' restored to life? Wouldn't a livin' god serve better'n a stiff one?
1�By Leviathan's whiskers!
1�Arrrg, there be no call fer beatin' yerself up on this, lass.Bearin' the burden o' this terrible knowledge, ye did what ye could.
1�The rest o' us, on the other hand, we been blissful in our ignorance all our lives, clueless 'bout our origin.
1�By me measure, things wouldn't of turned out so pretty if ye hadn't done the drudgery belowdecks.
1�Ye can be proud o' yer efforts, lil' missy.
1�Abyssea might never be her scenic old self again, but we're still standin' here, alive an' kickin'.The world's rebirth's begun, there be no denyin' that, but it ain't over either.

1�The situation ain't improvin' much, true, but neither has it been deterioratin'.If I ain't mistaken, there be some kind o' anchor keepin' this ship from smashin' into the jagged rocks o' apocalypse.
1�I'd stake me one good peeper them Champions o' Abyssea had somethin' t' do with it.
1�Might be they went an' met their maker--an' in more ways'n one, heh--but that don't mean their efforts were fer naught.
1�So where the hell did they go, an' what the devil did they do? Now I gots a nose fer treasure an' an eye fer booty, an' they're sayin' if we follow the trail we jus' might hit gold.
1�An' I judge ye well as well gets, lil' missy.I be on this ship with ye t' the bloody end, whether it takes us t' treasures untold, or Davy Jones's locker.
1�An' I know   shares the same sentiments.Ain't that right, matey?
1�Harharhar! That be the spirit, matey!Fer one not even o' our world, ye sure be dependable!
1�I mus' say, all o' this gets me buccaneer's blood pumpin'.
1�After all, it ain't everyday ye get t' stick it t' the man!Well, a god in this case...an' one who chooses death, t' boot.
1�There be no guarantees t' be had that a happy endin' awaits us.But it gives me heart,  , knowin' ye're fightin' on our side.
1�Till next time, promise me ye won't go gettin' yerself killed.
1�We been waitin' fer ye, matey.
1�Arrrg.   an' I, we talked--well, I blathered, more like--'bout that subject some when firs' we met.
1�It be something t' do with objects acrrross dimensions existin' at the same time, aye?
1�Crrrikey! Talk 'bout gettin' yer ship sunk.
1�Might be mankind sprung out from the loins o' this man-god, but each o' us've got a mind o' our own.An' me mind says this be nothin' I want no part o'!
1�No more, ye say? They up an' disappearrred someplace?

1�Arrrg, the currents an' storms in those there parts been feared fer their treacherousness, even since b'fore the gull dung splattered the sails.An' this pirate'd sooner skipper his ship from atop the deck, not among the fishes an' seaweeds.
1�Inside 'em crrraggy white things, aye?The one as stood in the plateau ain't there no more, I saw fer meself. Why, it's as if it weren't ever there t' begin with.
1�Arrrg, I ain't sure I follow.So that fandangle crystal be tryin' t' glue itself togetherrr. But what o' it?
1�What!? Be there no end t' this, woman!?Arrrg, but who be this pirate t' talk? Well, carry on, then.
1�Errr...ye've gone an' lost me again, lass.
1�O' Abyssea, but not part o' it? Large, but escapes notice?Blimey, lil' missy. Could ye dispense with the riddles an' spit it out already?
1�Well, shave me bearrrd an' call me senile!
1�Ye reckon? The same ones we been usin' all this while?
1�Our agents report frozen maws scattered across the land. But there seems t' be no way o' rrrousin' them.
1�Loves us not? What gives ye that impression, if I might ask?

1�Crikey, lil' missy. Most o' us can put two an' two together, but the figurrres ye play with be in the tens o' thousands.But seein' as we don't got nothin' else t' go on, I reckon this line o' possibility be as feasible as any.
1�...So, the caturae, eh?This recalls t' me mind reports o' folk feelin' their emotions bein' rrruled by some unknown force when confrontin' 'em.
1�Harharrr! Now that be the   I know!Errr, not that we been acquainted fer long, t' be sure.
1�Arrrg. Me hearties an' I be countin' on ye, matey.In the meantime, I be off t' dig us up more o' 'em maws, jus' in case we missed somethin'.
1�Ahoy there, matey! We been waitin' fer ye!
1�Arrrg, it seems yer instincts be right on the coin, lil' missy.
1�Whoa, missy, I don't recall rrrequestin' a lectu--
1�An' second, that ye be me senior by no small margin.I s'pose it won't cut it no more t' call ye ??lil' missy.?? Gahahahaha-arrrg!

1�T' venture a guess, I'd say this incomplete alignment be the reason why me folk get stripped o' half our strrrength in the crossin'.Much like a sailor gets relieved o' cloth an' coin when he visits a dodgy...errr, establishment.
1�There be no guessin' the horrors what await.But fact is, they be the best endowed t' deal with 'em, arrrg.
1�It be a right heavy burden. I pray they don't get crushed by it.
1�We been waitin' fer ye, matey.
1�That ye stand b'fore us now could only mean one thing: sweet victory! Arrrg!
1�This old pirate's met many an' more folk in his day, but none o' 'em could hold a candle t' ye, matey.
1�Ye've given us much,  , includin' the precious gift o' life--a chance at livin'. I only wish there be some way fer me an' me hearties t' repay ye.

1�B'fore I go wanderin' off, I feel obliged t' thank ye again fer puttin' up with me nigh endless prattlin'. Ye been a most attentive pair o' ears.Fare ye well, matey, an' may the wind always fill yer sails.
1�Greetings,  . My name is Esha'ntarl.Before I begin, please accept my apologies for having to appear before you in this unseemly state.

1�Unlike a chosen few, I do not possess the power to traverse worlds. For this reason, I requested that our meeting take place within the Hall of the Gods, that we might harness the energy that permeates these sacred grounds.
1�Judging by your expression, I gather we are already acquainted in your world.It would seem fate has had a hand in bringing us together once more.
1�Your wary expression tells me you have yet to cross paths with my counterpart in Vana'diel.
1�Nevertheless, fate has now deemed it fit that we meet.
1�The world of mortals--the collective lives of men--is as a great river, formed of innumerable tributaries converging upon a single, torrential flow.
1�And you,  , are as a single leaf borne on the current...a current that brings together fellow drifters as often as it parts them.
1�Be it distant future or forgotten past, such is your destiny as is writ in the stars.
1�A destiny you share with your counterpart in Abyssea...
1�The cataclysm that has ravaged the land--it is a thing spawned from the will of Promathia, a primeval divinity who has stirred to wakefulness with the coming of His worldly avatar.
1�Correct. Also known as the Twilight God, Promathia has existed alongside the Dawn Goddess Altana since the beginning of time.
1�Much knowledge pertaining to Promathia's existence has long lain hidden from the prying eyes of mortals.
1�Indeed, that the world was born from the tragedy that befell the two divinities is known only to a select few.
1�It was the Age of Gods. The Lord of Chaos, Promathia, desired and succumbed to complete death.
1�In Her grief, Altana bestowed upon the fallen deity the light of the true crystal, and in so doing gave birth to life.Thus was mankind created.
1�The true crystal, drained of its power, shattered into five parts.Bereft of its blessed light, the realm of gods was reduced into the world of mortals, Abyssea.
1�Yet the will of the gods persisted, graven deep within mankind. And with it, the dream that the world be returned to its former state...that Paradise, the realm of gods, be restored.
1�So too did the desire for death live on unfading, a smoldering darkness--an Emptiness--within the souls of mortals.
1�That is not the case, I fear, for it was the Twilight God's death that brought forth mankind. His resurrection would therefore spell our demise.

1�The disfiguring metamorphosis of the land is a manifestation of lives being reclaimed by Promathia.Drained of its power for eons, the true crystal, too, has begun to regain its erstwhile form and light.
1�The wheels of the world's rebirth have been set in motion.
1�Correct. The lattice-shaped breakdown of the land is proof positive of this reversion.
1�That this event would come to pass had been foretold since ancient times.It was my intent to be fully prepared when the day came--to be ready to avert disaster.
1�But in the end, I was powerless before the unyielding avalanche of fate.
1�That the people now suffer so is due to my impotence. The blame lies with me.
1�Gilgamesh...
1�Your theory in particular, Gilgamesh, bears further investigation.I, too, shall do what I can on this quarter.
1�For now, I take my leave of you. Fare you well.
1�Thank you once again for coming.I apologize that a location more convenient cannot be arranged.
1�My time is limited, as you are already aware, so pray excuse me if I seem curt.Tell me,  . Are you aware of the current state of Abyssea?
1�You are not wrong, Gilgamesh. Pray allow me to elaborate.
1�And it is that selfsame will that birthed the multitudinous new species that breathe only to eradicate mankind.
1�Promathia desires the reversion of the mortal realm into Paradise.However, this transformation cannot take place so long as mortals exist.
1�This is the truth behind that which the survivors have come to fear as the Abyssean hordes.
1�These creatures are, for all intents and purposes, emissaries of god.For mortals to be taken by them...some might be fain to call it salvation.

1�Eloquently said, Gilgamesh, and truer than you might know. For even as the Twilight God harbors death and Emptiness, so too does the desire for life survive within him. There is no greater proof of this than that mankind--His children--choose to fight for survival.
1�And so it is our destiny to make a stand, even should it mean defying the will of a god.
1�And defy it you did,  , the you and yours of Abyssea.
1�Our destination is the highest plane of existence: the celestial capital Al'Taieu.There is where the final battle between mankind and Promathia was waged.
1�Even should we determine its location, gaining access will not be a simple affair, I fear.Due to the cataclysm, the precious few gateways that once existed are no more.
1�Just so.
1�The crags Holla, Dem, and Mea--all three were gateways to the true crystal, linked to it via the Crystal Line.
1�That they have now disappeared could only mean one thing: the five fragments of the true crystal, too, are beginning to merge into one.
1�That the fragments are merging is past certain. The only question that remains, then, is where the joining will take place.
1�I believe that the answer we seek may be found on Qufim, the island which served as the point of convergence for the Crystal Line.
1�I regret to say, however, that the undersea cave linking Jeuno to the island, too, has been inaccessible since the collapse of Heavens Bridge.
1�Furthermore...
1�The likelihood is high that the celestial capital Al'Taieu has not in fact descended to Abyssea.

1�Forgive me, but the workings of apocalypse are seldom simple. I shall endeavor to explain things more plainly.The return of the Keeper of the Apocalypse should have spelled the end of mankind. Yet this has not come to pass.
1�And I credit your hypothesis to be the reason, Gilgamesh: that the Champions of Abyssea have done something to prevent the complete merging of dimensions.
1�There exists a place that has undergone drastic change--a place that is of Abyssea, yet not part of it.And though not small by any measure, it has largely escaped our notice.
1�As it please you, Gilgamesh.The place I speak of is none other than the moon.
1�The moon appears to have greatly increased in size. It is obvious, if only one knows to look.

1�Whether it has grown larger in actuality or has simply been drawn nearer to Abyssea cannot be readily determined. All things considered, however, I am compelled to believe it is to there that Al'Taieu has ascended.
1�The cavernous maws.
1�Being portals that connect our world Abyssea to  's own, it is not beyond imagining that the selfsame maws can take us to Al'Taieu.
1�Those are of no concern to us. For I am convinced the gateway we seek will not be so apparent, but rather hidden beyond mortal reach by a force that loves us not.
1�Of the heretofore unseen creatures that rose to prominence in the cataclysm's wake, none is shrouded in more mystery and held in greater trepidation than the caturae.
1� . I believe you already know what must be done.You must go forth and defeat the creatures. Yes, every last one.

1�The likelihood that the caturae block our path to salvation can be ill ignored.Even if eliminating them proves fruitless to our greater cause, it would nonetheless be a kindness to the survivors.
1�I am not unmindful of the immeasurable good you have already done for our cause. Yet we must ask for your aid once again.
1�Mankind is forever in your debt,  .
1�We know full well we send you into perilous domain. Please take all care.
1� . It gladdens me to see you safely returned.
1�Shortly after the last caturae was dispatched, a new source of dimensional disturbance manifested in your world.
1�As suspected, the twisted creatures are linked to the Twilight God, and theirs had indeed been the presence concealing the gateway to our destination.
1�The disturbance was detected on Qufim Island, by the southern edge of the wall outside Delkfutt's Tower.
1�When Al'Taieu ascended to the highest plane, part of it was left behind in the mortal realm.That part was none other than Qufim Island, the point of convergence for the Crystal Line.
1�The Sea of Shu'Meyo, it would interest you to know, was the terrestrial location of the celestial capital.My words would be made clearer if you examined a pre-cataclysm map of the area.
1�This, Gilgamesh, was precisely why I sent you to investigate Qufim's surrounds, ensuring that differences in existential phase were accounted for.
1�Although the caturae are eliminated and obstruct our passage no more, the newly formed gateway remains unfit to be traversed by one of Abyssea.
1�Pray make all haste for Qufim Island, and thence to the celestial capital, where the Keeper of the Apocalypse abides.
1�Yes. The hope of our entire world rests upon   and ?[his/her] comrades.
1�Welcome back,  .While it is still fresh in your mind, I would have you recount to us all that transpired.
1�I see... I am elated to learn that Prishe is alive and well.
1�The pain and suffering she has had to endure are beyond even my imagining.It is I, not she, who needs to apologize for being powerless to do more.

1�We Abysseans had stood on the precipice of destruction, every last person all but lost to hope. But a miracle appeared, instilling us with courage and resolve, ultimately saving us from a fate of certain destruction.
1�That miracle,  , is you. Our boundless gratitude is forever yours.
1�Although the Keeper of the Apocalypse is no more, the scars of tragedy remain graven within the hearts of mortals.
1�Yet time heals all wounds, no matter how deep they might run. And then people will rise again in united purpose and restore Abyssea to her former glory.
1�Even now, the seeds of new lives--of a new and resilient generation--are sprouting, taking root.
1�...Yes, Gilgamesh. Like a tree.
1�I know not the future that awaits you, the branches of eventualities that lie along the way.
1�Yet in a world of infinite possibilities, it cannot be ruled out that the cataclysm that befell Abyssea may one day descend upon Vana'diel.
1�You must stay strong and ever ready,  , for the time may come when your uncommon courage and valor will be needed once more.
1�Before I take my leave, I have one last favor to ask of you. It concerns Prishe.

1�For all her carefree demeanor, she has known naught but hardship and suffering her entire life.It would mean much to both Prishe and me if you would pay her visit on occasion, whenever time permits.
1�As your counterpart in Abyssea stood by her, easing the pain that racks her gentle heart, so too would I ask the same of you.
1�Thank you,  , and farewell.May the stars shine their countenance upon you, always.
1�You are  , correct?
1�Permit me to introduce myself. I am Esha'ntarl, representative of Archduke Kam'lanaut of the Grand Duchy of Jeuno.
1�Ah, but your face belies your surprise at seeing one such as me here. Despite my position, I am given free reign to go where I please.
1�I heard tell of a young woman struggling to save the world from oblivion together with her master...an adventurer. You.
1�I desired but to lay my own two eyes on ?[his/her] visage.
1�I had an inkling you would be here.
1�You must be taken aback to be reunited with me here, of all places.
1�To think we had prevented the world from ending one way, only to find out it would end another...
1�And Iroha? Is she not with you?
1�I understand you have no reason to place your trust in me, but know this--I wish only to shelter this world from harm.
1�Surely you can sense that my words ring true.
1�Please. Apprise me of what you have learned thus far.
1�Please. Apprise me of what you have learned thus far.
1�So Iroha expired and has yet to return to this mortal coil.
1�Revival is in the realm of the gods, and if she has not yet returned, it may be because they do not permit it.
1�Should she be struggling in earnest against this void...this ??Cloud of Darkness,?? then it is but a matter of time before they see fit to bring her here once more.
1�Unless...Unless their own powers have begun to wane and they have little time left.
1�Only the ancients--the Zilart--possess the means by which to open these gates.
1�I shall unbar the way.
1�Ah, but you are already in possession of 6????. I should have expected no less.
!?�I see. So that masked man is, for lack of a better term, a future you that has succumbed to darkness.
1�A fallen angel, if you will. I sense that your words do not ring false.
1�But let us reflect. If he came to our time to prevent you from becoming a god of light...
1�...Then the logical conclusion is that you have the capability to do so.
1�So you wish to know a more concrete method for becoming a god of light.
1�Would that I could provide you with answers, but I cannot surmise what Yve'noile had in mind.
